intro: Chrysothemis dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by a disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Chrysothemis dichroa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
